products.title: Apple iPod Touch
products.description:
The Apple iPod Touch is a media player and Internet interactive tool. This is the 4th generation of the Apple iPod Touch, and includes two cameras, one on either side of the device. This allows video conferencing and messaging over a Wi-Fi connection. Also new to this version is a 3.5 inch Retina display, which shows images at 326 pixels per inch to create more detail than the eye can pick up. Local maps are also now available but the Touch still lacks a GPS receiver, allowing quick directions from many locations. Connections to the App Store and iTunes can run through a standard Wi-Fi connection, and a Bluetooth connection allows for additional functionality and backups. Email and web browsing is fully supported, as well as browsing YouTube. Video display can be as detailed as the high-definition 720p standard.

Features

  • FaceTime with 2 cameras (new)
  • 3.5 in Retina display, 960 x 640 pixels (new, 326 pixels per inch)
  • HD Video Recording
  • 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 2.1 & EDR connectivity
  • Movies & TV shows, up to 720p 30 frames per second, MP4, M-JPEG
  • 8 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB memory
  • App Store, iTunes access
  • Mail, Safari web browser, YouTube
  • Photos
  • Voice Control
  • Maps
  • Voice Memos
  • Headphones included

pros.text: super high resolution 'Retina' display - the same as that found in the iPhone 4 (960 x 640px)
now features the A4 processor - the same technology found in the latest iPhone, very powerful while still being energy efficient
capable of 720p high definition video capture (can be edited on the device too)
capable of FaceTime video chat with iPhone 4 users
new GameCenter brings social interaction to playing games over WiFi with friends and other random people
beautiful design
7.2mm thin - improved dimensions over the iPhone 4
fully capable of running the majority of iOS 4 applications - the most popular mobile platform
made of high quality materials - glass and stainless steel
runs the latest version of Apple's mobile operating system - iOS 4
an all-around entertainment platform, not just an MP3 player - capable of browsing the internet, gaming, running other types of useful applications
the same price as the last generation at launch (doesn't start more expensive and get cheaper as the device gets older, as is common with most consumer electronics - a great deal to buy at launch)
A very thin device with an amazing processor and many capabilities
full motion capture for intuitive user interface response, gaming and application control - 3-axis gyroscope and accelerometer
now each model has the latest internal components and features (irrespective of the capacity of the device)
can easily be jailbroken and used to its full capacity freely
A Microphone
beautifull
available a week after launch

cons.text: works with iTunes only - designed with a proprietary 'walled garden' approach in mind (the intention to sell you music and applications from a single source, limit how you use your device)
FaceTime is limited - only accessible to those with an iPhone 4 or this generation of the iPod Touch
the same price throughout its life cycle (generally becomes a worse deal as the year progresses as an upgraded model will be available for the same cost to the consumer in September)
Even though it uses a 'Retina' display, uses a lower quality screen which means darker picture and lesser viewing angles compared to the iPhone 4.
Low quality camera, great for 720p video, but still images have a low resolution of 960x720.
the same capacities as the last generation
the same predatory 8GB to 32GB capacity jump (as most people would be happy with 16)
no innovation when it comes to music / audio - a continued focus on improved use as an all-around entertainment / gaming platform
designed for aesthetic look / elegance rather than usability and durability

related.title: Apple iPod Shuffle
related.description:
Apple iPod Shuffle is a portable MP3 player built to be as small and light as possible. New to the fourth generation release is clickable track and volume controls, which had been removed in the third generation in favor of touch controls. While the design resembles the second generation, the click wheel is 18% larger for easier use. A new VoiceOver function allows for a computer-generated voice to read the artist and track name to the listener at the touch of a button. Multiple playlists are also now supported, and Genius Mixes are enabled for automatically generated lists. A built-in clip allows for easy fastening to clothes or other accessories, and a 2GB storage capacity is built in as well.

Features

  • Square form factor
  • Light and small design
  • Large clicking buttons
  • VoiceOver button
  • Multiple playlists, Genius Mixes
  • 2GB storage
  • Built-in clip

pros.text: available in five colours
ample 2GB of storage for the occasional music / podcast listener
affordable price point
quality materials and build
'voice over' functionality carries over for the last generation - improves overall usability of the device by allowing the user to find out what song is playing, navigate playlists
quite compact and lightweight - not cumbersome for use on the go, working out, etc...
can now be used with any headphones you want
brings back the physical controls over the silly control-less design of the last generation
beautiful Apple aesthetic
built-on clip for securing the shuffle to clothing
always the same price (doesn't start more expensive and get cheaper as the device gets older, as is common with most consumer electronics - a great deal to buy at launch)

cons.text: clip lacks a good front finger grip for pinching - leads user to hitting the back button when trying to clip the device while in use
a step backwards to the second generation design
the same price throughout its life cycle (generally becomes a worse deal as the year progresses as an upgraded model will be available for the same cost to the consumer in September)
works with iTunes only - designed with a proprietary 'walled garden' approach in mind (the intention to sell you music and applications from a single source, limit how you use your device)
no display - very difficult to use for those uninterested in micromanaging playlists, wanting specific songs or podcasts without the hassle
